description: From Middle English pertenen, from Old French partenir (modern French appartenir), in turn from Latin pertineō, pertinēre.

verbs.description: pertain (third-person singular simple present pertains, present participle pertaining, simple past and past participle pertained)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To belong to or be a part of; be an adjunct, attribute, or accessory of.
examples: That spare wheel pertains to this car.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To relate, to refer, be relevant to.
examples: That question doesn't pertain to the topic, so I'm not going to answer it.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To apply; to be or remain in place; to continue to be applicable.
